acf.heading: Get an amitriptyline (Elavil) prescription online.
acf.first_paragraph: Select your symptoms within the Maple app so the doctor can evaluate your symptoms and condition. Enter as much information as possible so that the doctor can make a thorough assessment.

accordion.accordion_title: What is amitriptyline (Elavil) and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Amitriptyline is a type of medication known as a tricyclic antidepressant, and is primarily used to treat depression. It does so by increasing the level of certain chemicals in your brain, such as the concentration of norepinephrine and serotonin).

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for amitriptyline (Elavil)?
accordion.accordion_intro: Amitriptyline is used to relieve symptoms of depression. It may help improve mood and feelings of well-being, relieve anxiety and tension, as well as increase energy levels.

Amitriptyline is available as a tablet and should be taken as directed by a doctor. This medication can be taken with or without food once at night. Tablet forms come in doses varying from 10mg to 150mg.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of amitriptyline (Elavil)?
accordion.accordion_intro:
As your body adjusts to the medication, amitriptyline may cause:

  • Confusion, headache, blurred vision
  • Numbness and tingling in your arms and legs
  • Constipation, diarrhea, nausea
  • Drowsiness
  • Skin rash, swelling of your face and tongue
  • Unexpected weight gain or loss
accordion.accordion_content: Additionally, some users may experience chest pain or pressure, pounding heartbeats or fluttering in chest, a seizure, painful or difficult urination, easy bruising or unusual bleeding. If any of these severe side effects occur, it is important to speak to a doctor as soon as possible.

accordion.accordion_intro: Amitriptyline should not be taken if you have recently had a heart attack or if you have used an MAO inhibitor in the past 14 days. Tell your doctor if you are pregnant or plan to become pregnant while using this medication. Amitriptyline is not approved for use by anyone younger than 12 years old.
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
